instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: Got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on the bench with no sign of liquid damage. The board works but when I connect to 85W magsafe it will not turn on. It will turn on with either a 60W or my lab bench PSU 85W plug made from genuine MS2. I checked the ISL and SCL, SDA lines and they measure .529 on Diode and 3.42V. I tried other batteries but still draws 3 Amp with battery plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message:
Run HWMonitor and look at voltage and current sensors.
Does it turn on with 85W, in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message:
Things that stand out to me in HW Monitor are:
PECI SA is 0 degrees
CPU VRM E is 0v
Mainboard S0 Rail is 2.89A
Memory module 1 is consuming 1.07W

Battery is charging, just drawing 3Amps of current.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: So weird, when the laptop goes to sleep it only draws 1.2A.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: It turns on in SMC bypass mode with the 85W on the bench PSU, but not the one that plugs into wall. BTW I strictly use OEM MS2 chargers purchased from a store.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: It will also turn on with a 60W MS2 as well. I will try a 45W

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: Sorry, I meant it will NOT run on a 60W charger. In fact, the only charger is DOES work on is the one that is hooked up to my Bench PSU. It will not run from an 85W, 60W, or 45W MS2. <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> or <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message:
Input leakage.
Post <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86 ohm value, measured onboard.
Also check <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>: 100K
<RESISTOR>R7181</RESISTOR>: 62.7K
<RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>: 470K
<RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR>: 331K

<DIODE>D7012</DIODE>: 6.83V

I had to replace <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> just now as it broke. is working with PSU 85W and regular 60W but not 85W

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: It does not work with OEM 45W MS2 either, Just Bench PSU 85W cable and OEM 60W

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: Which voltages get on the board with 45/85W original charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: Was getting 0v, started measuring components at the beginning of the charging circuit and found <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> was reading 440K. Replaced it, now running off of all chargers with a green/orange MS2 light. Still have another issue though. The charge current still wants to run away. It starts low then ramps up to 3 Amps, which is the limit for this power supply. So far I have replaced <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> and now <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>. Still have some hunting to do. I swapped a different board for the client so this one belongs to me now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message:
Are you still working with PSU???

Use original charger and check current and voltage with HWMonitor...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message: Nope, original MS2. Will check voltages with HWMonitor and report back

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Drawing 3 Amps
threads.message:
"Nope, original MS2."
Where did you see the 3A current then?
Use original Magsafe 2 CHARGER, not only cable!!!
